RainbruRPG::Core::gsGame

RainbruRPG::Core::gsGame Class Reference

List of all members.

Detailed Description

The game GameState.

This class provides the ingame GameState.

It can load a example Quake3 map, debug the colision detection (triangle selector and model highligthing).

Warning:
The Event Receiver must be set up in the IrrlichtDevice in the run() method. If we do it in the init() method, the IrrlichtDevice isn't yet initialized and it cause a SegFault.

Member Function Documentation

void RainbruRPG::Core::gsGame::cleanup (  )  [virtual]

The destructor of the game state.

void RainbruRPG::Core::gsGame::createGui (  ) 

Creates the gui of the game GameState.

Do nothing.

void RainbruRPG::Core::gsGame::drawDebug (  ) 

The begug drawing method.

It is called by the run() method only if debug is set to true. It will refresh all the debugging tools (billboard, triangle and model selection).

void RainbruRPG::Core::gsGame::init (  )  [virtual]

The constructor of the game state.

void RainbruRPG::Core::gsGame::initBillboard (  ) 

Add a billboard scene node to the Irrlicht scene manager for debugging purpose.

It creates a billboard with the image file data/3d/particle.bmp.

void RainbruRPG::Core::gsGame::initCamera (  )

void RainbruRPG::Core::gsGame::loadExampleMap (  ) 

Loads an example Quake 3 map.

void RainbruRPG::Core::gsGame::pause (  )  [virtual]

Pause the game GameState.

It will stop the Irrlicht Device timer and disable the player's camera input. You may call resume() to continue playing.

void RainbruRPG::Core::gsGame::resume (  )  [virtual]

Resume the game after a pause() call.

It reinitialize the erGame event receiver, send it to the Irrlicht device and set the mouse cursor invisible.

void RainbruRPG::Core::gsGame::run (  )  [virtual]

The drawing method.

This method is called by the GameEngine for each frame. It just calls the Irrlicht draw function. It also calls the drawDebug() method if debug is set to true.

Member Data Documentation

scene::IBillboardSceneNode* RainbruRPG::Core::gsGame::bill [private]

The scene node used to draw a billboard.

bool RainbruRPG::Core::gsGame::debug [private]

Enable or disable all the debug tools.

The debug tools are the billboard, the triangle selector and the model detector. If debug is set to false, none of the debug tools will be enabled, even if there are one. If you set debug to true, you must also set to true the debug tools you want to enabled.

bool RainbruRPG::Core::gsGame::debugBillboard [private]

Enable or disable all the triangle selection debugging tool.

Draws a billboard (a round particle) in front of the player.

This debug tool is used only if debug is set to true. If debug is set to false, this boolean will not be considered

bool RainbruRPG::Core::gsGame::debugModelSelection [private]

Enable or disable all the model selection debugging tool.

Highlights the pointed model.

This debug tool is used only if debug is set to true. If debug is set to false, this boolean will not be considered

bool RainbruRPG::Core::gsGame::debugTriangleSelection [private]

Enable or disable all the triangle selection debugging tool.

Highlights the triangle pointed by the player in red.

This debug tool is used only if debug is set to true. If debug is set to false, this boolean will not be considered

Set if we debug the selector.

If true, this will highligth the triangle in front of player in red
